page.title: 10Sarah Ann Jones.
page.content: {SARAH ANN JONES Over the entrance of the Town Hall is a carving of a young woman's head.Sarah Ann Jones lived with her husband Frank in a miners cottage in Church Square.It was the job of the women,in those days,to have children and look after their husbands.Sarah Ann had eight children,four boys and four girls.In 1859 a new Market Hall (Town Hall) was built.Each day Sarah would take the yolk and 2 pails to fetch their daily water at St.Chads Well.She stopped each day to see how the building was going on and one day a stone mason asked if he could sketch her face.He then carved her face in stone and it was placed over the front door.Sarah had some unhappiness in her lifetime.Her husband was killed in the Welton Pit and her son,Drummer Frank died,aged 17,at the Norton Hill Mine.
